situation.title: School accommodation facilities
situation.meta_description: The school accommodation facilities are now prohibited from providing accommodation to pupils and students.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Due to the unfavourable epidemiological situation, the school accommodation facilities are now prohibited from providing accommodation to pupils and students who have other housing in the Czech Republic. This also applies to university students.

There are some exceptions. For example, the exception has students participating in practical training as part of their medical and pedagogical courses or students who have been ordered to work duty.

I live in a hall of residence

Pupils and students who do not have other housing in the Czech Republic can stay in the dormitories. Other housing means a place where you have your permanent address or a place where you feel at home. You can stay in a residence hall if you can provide a statement that the dormitory is the place where you feel at home the most.

If you continue to live in your hall of residence, follow the hygienic measures (wear a mask - wash your hands regularly - keep a two-meters distance from others).

However, the Ministry of Education is urging pupils and students to, when possible, return home to reduce social contacts between individuals. University halls of residence are deciding on details of their operation independently. If you have any questions, please contact the dormitory operator directly. If you are in danger of a difficult social situation in connection with these measures, contact your school, as universities may award a social scholarship to you. Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs is also offering financial support.

questions_answers.question: Can I stay in the hall of residence if I have my permanent address in Slovakia?
questions_answers.value: Yes. The condition is that you do not have any other housing in the Czech Republic.

questions_answers.question: Are housing and permanent address the same thing?
questions_answers.value: Housing and permanent address can overlap and be the same, but it is not a condition. In this sense, the decisive thing is where you feel at home. For example, if you have your permanent address in Most, but you are studying or working in Prague where you also live, have friends and hobbies, your housing will be in Prague.

questions_answers.question: Who decides when the university halls of residence are going to open?
In which case can I stay in the hall of residence?
questions_answers.value: If you do not have other housing in the Czech Republic and you can prove that.
